name: Cinnamon Grand Colombo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Cinnamon Grand for a total of 7 nights spread out over 2 weeks (had booked a cultural tour, and beach stay in between our stops in Colombo). As it was my girlfriend's first trip to Sri Lanka, I had researched our holiday before making any bookings. In the past I had stayed at the Holiday Inn and Galadari and found both to be reasonable in quality and price. Cinnamon Grand was recommended to me by my cousin who works in the tourism industry, and I am really glad we took her advice. The hotel is situated on Galle Road in Colpetty (Colombo 3). It is a short walk away from the southern point of Galle Face and an easy walk from Fort. For travelling around Colombo, Tuk-Tuks are numerous and you can haggle with the drivers until you reach a good price (knock a 3rd off the initial sum, and agree before you set off). There is a decent shopping centre next door to the hotel, but the stores seem to mainly cater for tourists, so expect to pay more than in smaller stores. If you don't want to eat in the hotel, there are many restaurants nearby (we recommend the Bavarian restaurant opposite the Galle Face Hotel).
reviews.title: Would definitely stay there again

reviews.text: The Cinnamon Grand is quite modern, with a nice, open lobby area. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are very clean, and have all the facilites you would require. Restaurants are among the best we have eaten at (breakfasts were out of this world with plenty of fresh fruit, european items, as well as Sri Lankan hoppers and curries).

reviews.text: The Cinnamon Grand in Colombo would have to be one of the better hotels in Colombo if a little large and impersonal. Located conveniently right next to the Crescat Boulevard shopping centre and within 10 minutes drive of just about anywhere we had to go (apart from the airport), we enjoyed a night at an English pub, lazing around the pool in a beautifully landscaped garden (complete with resident tortoise), and even just sitting in the lobby sipping a cuppachino and listening to the music of the grand piano. The hotel seems to have gone a bit off track with a little experiment in rustic nostalgia which they call Nuga Gama which purports to be an authentic Sri Lankan village. This comes off as being antiseptically clean and plastic (unlike any Sri Lankan village we encountered in our trip) and with food best avoided if you have meetings the next day. However the quality of the Lagoon seafood restaurant, the Tao outdoor restaurant and Chutney’s – their Indian restaurant, are what you would expect of a 5-star hotel and more.
reviews.title: Great location, great environment, avoid eating at Nuga Gama

reviews.text: The staff were very professional, prompt and courteous. However I got the impression whether right or wrong, the staff kept their distance from the guests. The exception to the normal was a Mr Jagath Rajapakse who worked in and around the gym and the swimming pool area who went out of his way to be friendly and to ensure that not only us but other guests had or were given what we requested. The same applied to a lady named Visakha at breakfast time who ensured that we and the other guests got what we wanted and showed friendship and behaved in a very professional manner.

It's located on Galle road, close to the beachfront area, and is pretty central to all the shopping, restaurants and sight seeing in Colombo. There are many casinos close by, and the popular Odel Shopping Mall is less than 10 mins away.

reviews.text: Happened to stay in Cinnamon Grand while on a business trip to Colombo in Nov 2008. We checked in around 2AM in the night and found that the lobby still had some guests lounging around ..later we learnt that the hotel lobby was the 'happening ' place of Colombo. the rooms were superbly done up . i think it was the new wing of th ehotel, with excellent interiors, stylish lighting, spotless bathrooms etc etc. The breakfast was amazing with a wide variety of food, the pool was inviting and I took a quick dip to esacape the sultry weather . th elocation is great with the Galle face promenade within short walk . We discovered the exquisite Raja Bhojun restaurant right oppossite and also found some time to experience the wonderful spa adjacent to the hotel. By the way the Crescat Boulevard is a cute little mall to satisfy your shopping needs while in Colombo, it also has food court .About the only thing which bothered us was the excessive security the moment u stepped out of the hotel , couldnt even go for a walk near the sea after sunset . Would surely like to come back here whenever I get the chance
reviews.title: Efficient and good location

description: Just 35 kilometers from the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), luxurious Cinnamon Grand Colombo is located in the heart of Colombo City’s business, shopping and entertainment center.Elegantly designed, spacious rooms at the Cinnamon Grand offer a wide range of in room amenities, king size beds, and a pillow menu to ensure your comfort and pleasure. All rooms feature carefully attended-to bathrooms and toiletries, large flat screen TVs, a mini bar, and WiFi access.The hotel’s 14 restaurants provide an electric mix of international cuisines, including award winning Sri Lankan seafood at the Lagoon Restaurant & Garden, and the best of European fine dining at the London Grill.To wind down, guests can patronize Cinnamon Grand’s poolside ‘Breeze Bar’ or typical British pub style ‘Cheers Pub’, and enjoy a wide range of cocktails, beer and fresh juices.There are two gymnasiums, a spa retreat, a tennis court and two pools. Cinnamon Grand is also located right next to Colombo’s high end shopping mall, Crescat Boulevard.Cinnamon Grand Colombo is fully accessible and is an environmentally friendly property.
